(verb) to get something: (verb) to judge or deide the amount, value, quality, or importance of something
(noun) a useful or valuable quality, skill or person // something valuable belonging to a person or organization that can be used for payment of debts
(noun) something that is dangerous and likely to cause damage
(adj) belonging to or shared between two or more people
(verb) to make a legal agreement by which money is paid in order to use land, a building, a vehicle, or a piece of equipment for an agreed period of time
(noun) the fact that someone is legally responsible for something
(noun) a person who owns a particular type of business, especially a hotel, a shop or a company that make newspapers
(adj) being one only; single // not shared with anyone else
